snippet: If you are proactive against germs and plan for emergencies, you can protect your health when you travel.
abstract: Business travelers can avoid becoming sick from frequent trips if they follow some proactive tips to protect against germs; those who do get sick can mitigate the damage to themselves and their travels with proper planning. Drawing (M)t
lead_paragraph: FOR Dr. Philip M. Tierno, business travel means combat. The enemy is heartless and relentless, stealthy and ubiquitous. It is poised to attack every second of the day, even when he's asleep. It exploits his rare moments of weakness and turns everyone and everything around him into agents who thoughtlessly do its bidding. Dr. Tierno is not a corporate security expert trying to outflank rogue competitors. His enemy is infectious disease. He's a professor of microbiology at the New York University School of Medicine who sees the common places of travel -- cabs, airports, airplanes, hotels, restaurants and business meetings -- as battlefields in the never-ending war against germs.

headline.main: Your Road Buddies: Zillions of Germs
